result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin Carnel Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: approved /s/ TBE 02/29/16 with attached purchase order indicating "no reimbursement required"

Defendant Dustin Carnel Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF344 & 15CF345
8:56 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

State files Amended Informations in both files. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Kryshak makes statements re: amended information in 15CF345 should be misdemeanor theft. 
Atty Constable states correction.  Count 1 in 15CF345 should be 943.20(1)(a) & (3)(a) as a Class A Misdemeanor.  Will file a 2nd amended information with that change. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Kryshak waives the reading of the amended informations. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  
15CF344 all counts - NO CONTEST
15CF345 both counts - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF344 Counts 1, 2 & 3, 15CF345 Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF344 
Count 1 - 
180 days jail STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Court does not allow electronic monitor. 

Count 2 - 
120 days jail, concurrent with Count 1 STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Court does not allow electronic monitor. 

Count 3 - 
90 days jail, concurrent with Counts 1 & 2 STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Court does not allow electronic monitor. 

Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Provide DNA sample. 
Pay DNA surcharge.  
Perform 50 hours community service on Count 1. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Participate in fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both. 
Possess no dangerous weapons. 
Letter of apology to the victim and submit that to the agent within 60 days. 
Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Pay court costs. 

15CF345 
Count 1 - 
180 days jail, concurrent with 15CF344 STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.

Count 2 - 
90 days jail, concurrent with Count 1 & 15CF344
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent with 15CF344: 
Same conditions as ordered in 15CF344. 
(Only one 50 hour community service order). 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Dustin Carnel Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF344, 15CF345
Court questions Atty Kryshak re: waivers. 
Atty Kryshak indicates both files will be waived. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dustin Carnel Williams in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF345 and 15CF344.
 Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin Carnel Williams in court.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:23 pm. Court calls case.
Defendant is sworn in by the clerk
Court questions defendant regarding income and 
expenses to determine indigence status.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the defendant indigent.

Bond covers both 15CF344 & 15CF345.
No contact whatsoever with Arthur Spohn or Robert Fay. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Report to the Public Defenders office today (10/12/15)  If no one can see him today, he is to go there tomorrow as soon as possible.

Defendant Dustin Carnel Williams in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF344, 15CF345

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he would like to try to hire counsel.  If he can't then he'd like to try the public defender. 

Court will adjourn to allow the defendant to consult/retain counsel. 
Atty Cousins recommends a $10,000 signature bond to encompass both files with conditions as stated.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
